title: Missing Test Script Configuration in package.json
root_cause_summary: The CI/CD pipeline is failing because there's no test script specified in the package.json file. This is causing the 'npm test' command to fail, as it doesn't know what tests to run.
root_cause_detailed: In Node.js projects, the 'npm test' command looks for a 'test' script in the package.json file. If this script is not defined, npm returns an error 'no test specified'. This error is propagated to the CI/CD pipeline, causing the build to fail. The absence of this script suggests that either tests haven't been set up for the project, or the configuration to run existing tests is missing.

fix_suggestions.title: Add a test script to package.json
fix_suggestions.description: This fix adds a placeholder test script to package.json, which will allow the 'npm test' command to run without errors. This is a quick fix to get the pipeline passing, but doesn't actually run any tests.
implementation_steps: Step 3: Add a "test" script with a placeholder command

fix_suggestions.title: Implement actual tests
fix_suggestions.description: This fix involves creating and implementing real tests for the project. While more time-consuming, this is the best long-term solution as it will actually test your code.
implementation_steps: Step 1: Choose a testing framework (e.g., Jest, Mocha)
Step 2: Install the chosen testing framework
Step 3: Write test files for your code
Step 4: Update package.json to run these tests

fix_suggestions.title: Adjust GitHub Actions workflow
fix_suggestions.description: If tests are already implemented but not being recognized, the issue might be in the GitHub Actions workflow configuration. This fix involves modifying the workflow to properly execute the tests.
implementation_steps: Step 1: Open the GitHub Actions workflow file (.github/workflows/your-workflow.yml)
Step 2: Locate the step that runs tests
Step 3: Ensure the correct command is being used to run tests
Step 4: Add error handling or verbose output for debugging
fix_suggestions.source: GitHub Actions documentation and common CI/CD practices

research_summary: Web research revealed that the 'no test specified' error is common in Node.js projects and can be quickly resolved by adding a test script to package.json. However, implementing actual tests is considered best practice. GitHub Actions errors can often be resolved by adjusting workflow configurations.
